SortableTable Class Reference

This class is a one or two line Array of dataType with a sort feature on one of the lines. More...

 Sorts the two row table using rowToSort as the row to sort (row numbering start at 1).
void sort ()

Detailed Description

This class is a one or two line Array of dataType with a sort feature on one of the lines.

The sort is an implementation of the quick sort algorithm.

Author:
Lynn Hazan

Member Function Documentation

void SortableTable::setSize ( dataType  nbOfColumns,
bool  twoRows = true 
) [inline]

Sets the dimensions of the table, by default it will be a two row table.

Parameters:
nbOfColumns numbero f column for the table.
twoRows true if the table has to be a two row table, false if it has to be a one row table, the default is true.

void SortableTable::subset ( SortableTable &  subsetTable,
dataType  row,
dataType  startColumn,
dataType  endColumn 
)

Returns a subset of the table, the data from one row (row) contained between startColumn and endColumn.

The data are store in a one row table. If row equals 2 but the table is a one row table, nothing is done.

Parameters:
subsetTable an empty table where the data will be store. The size of this table will become (1,startColumn - endColumn).
row the row to get the data from.
startColumn first column from where to get the data.
endColumn last column from where to get the data.
